hanzi-su-wiki:
興

Значения

Интерес, увлечение; расцветать, процветать; поднимать, начинать, восстанавливать; увлечение

Мнемоника

Искажено. Четыре руки, поднимающие груз и действующие совместно 同, в такт. Дружная работа становится удовольствием и приносит радость.

Варианты

兴
purpleculture_pinyin:
xīng
to rise; to flourish; to become popular; to start; to encourage; to get up; (often used in the negative) to permit or allow (dialect); maybe (dialect)
подниматься; процветать; стать популярным; начать; поощрять; встать; (часто используется в отрицании) разрешать или разрешать (диалект); возможно (диалект)

xìng
feeling or desire to do sth; interest in sth; excitement
чувство или желание что-то делать; интерес к чему-то; возбуждение

興興RS
兴兴		thrive, prosper, flourish, rise
  • RS. hands lifting 舁 together 同: the group rises, thrives and is prosperous

heisig_chinese_memo: Looks like a big stereo system which is a very common way to create excitement around the world.
heisig_constituent: entertain, staples, same, monks, hood, one, mouth, tool, animal legs, eight
heisig_story: Mortar . . . same . . . tool. Be careful to make an image that keeps same in the middle.
Keyword_KKLC:
RISE TO PROSPERITY, rouse up
AMUSEMENT, interest
Keyword_KKLC_ru:
подняться к процветанию, будить вверх
развлечение, интерес
koohiiStory1: To me, this looks like a pictograph of a road leading to the big city (see the buildings?) where there are plenty of places to be entertained. Unfortunately in this city, every store is the same: staples. What tools! [ayoung24].
koohiiStory2: Photographically, this kanji simply looks like a set of two speakers (the staples primitives) between the sub-woofer (primitive for same) -- all this as a tool to entertain a group of drunks at a club.
jp_example_words:
興じる(きょうじる): to amuse oneself, to make merry
興業(こうぎょう): industrial enterprise
興奮(こうふん): excitement, stimulation, agitation, arousal
新興(しんこう): rising, developing, emergent
振興(しんこう): promotion, encouragement
復興(ふっこう): revival, renaissance, reconstruction
余興(よきょう): side show, entertainment
興味(きょうみ): interest
jp_readingExamples: 興行 (こうぎょう), 復興 (ふっこう), 振興 (しんこう), 興す (おこ.す), 興る (おこ.る)
WaniKani_Meaning_Mnemonic: There’s a comb and what looks like the same comb, and you found them on the ground next to some fins you showed interest in. At first, the shiny fins on the ground caught your interest, but once you got closer to the fins you also noticed a pair of combs that are interesting too.
WaniKani_Meaning_Info: Pick up these fins and the two combs. Feel their weight in each hand as you examine them with interest. Smell the fish smell and feel the teeth on the combs.
WaniKani_Reading_Mnemonic: Since the combs interest you more than the fins, you examine the combs more closely. Taking interest in where they were made, you discover they were made in きょうと. Dang, きょうと sure does make some nice combs.
WaniKani_Reading_Info: You've always had an interest in きょうと, so it makes sense that you'd be interested in things from きょうと too.
Ru_Radicals: 一 (один), ハ, 冂 (перевёрнутая коробка), 口 (рот), 臼 (ступа)
Ru_trainchinese:

xīng: (глаг/нареч) становиться популярным; (диал.) разрешать; (диал.) может быть
xīng: (графема) начинать; (книжн.) подниматься
Kanshudo_mnemonic: the same (同) split mortar (𦥑) on the table (丌) is entertainment
chinese_mnemonics_deck__story: Owls aren't known for their animal legs but wait till you see this one hit the dance floor and make it explode with excitement!
origin_of_ch_char_book: (同, tong, same) the upper thing means a rammer that is used to harden the ground by ramming, in the middle is the mouth (口, kou, mouth). A ground rammer needs two people to pick up and hit the ground at the same time. When people ramming the ground, they usually shout together. Thus this character is used as ‘same’. This character is also used to express dancing together. (興, 兴, xing=hsing, excitement) has four hands (共, gong, common; altogether) which mean people together. The middle symbolizes ‘ramming the ground together’ (同, tong, same). Therefore, this character implies everyone standing up, hand-in-hand, excitedly dancing and singing together.
humanum_full_description_en:
Oracle starts from " slip " from " same ", like raising a tube or barrel with four hands together. Under " Same " or next to "口". The original meaning is to rise up. "Er Ya. "Explanation": "Xing, rise." "Shuowen": "Xing, rise. From the same, the same force."

The oracle bone inscriptions are used as the name of the person and the country. For example, in the collection of 7076: "Wuwu Bu, 㱿ding (zhen): Fuqi and Xing." " Xing " from " tong ", oracle bone inscriptions can be saved as " tong ", For example, "Collection": "Shoulder Fan (Xing) 㞢 (have) 疒 (illness)." " Tong " is pronounced " Xing ", which means that the disease has improved and the condition has improved. (Cai Zhemao, Wang Ziyang)

Bronze inscriptions are used as the names of people and clan, such as Xingding: "Xingzha (made) Baoding." It means launching and invigorating soldiers, such as Duhufu: "Fan Xingshi is armored, with more than 50 soldiers, and he will surely know the ruler. I dare to do it."

The script " Xing " in silk and silk indicates the rise, such as "Guodian Jian. "The Tao of Tang Yu" Jian 8: "The six emperors prospered in the ancient times, all 𥝩 (from) this also." It also means prospering soldiers, such as "Mawangdui Silk Book. "Warring States Strategist Book" 264 lines: "Nai Cheng (police) within the four Jing (Jing), Xing Shi, Yan save 𩏑 (Han)." It also expresses the need, such as "Sleeping Tiger Land Qin Jian. The Eighteen Kinds of Laws of the Qin Dynasty" Jian 117: "The county should maintain the forbidden garden and the cattle and horses in the male cattle garden. For the garden, the apprentices were recruited to build trenches, walls, fences and repairs for the garden.

Examples of the original meaning of " Xing " in the handed down ancient books are like "Poetry. Wei Feng. Rogue": "Su thrive at night, sleep in the night." Zheng Xuanjian: Get up early and sleep at night. "The Analects. "Wei Ling Gong": "In Chen Jueliang, the Congzhe is sick, and Mo Nengxing."

" Xing " also means rise and establishment. Such as "Lu's Spring and Autumn. Great Music: "Four eras are prosperous, either hot or cold, short or long." "Historical Records. "Benji of Emperor Wen": "Han Xing, to Xiaowen more than forty years, morality is also prosperous." It also means the establishment and establishment. Such as "Salt Iron Theory. "This proposal": "While the cost is insufficient, the salt and iron are developed, and the wine bar is set up. All the purchases are lost.

" Xing " means mobilization and mobilization. Such as "Poetry. Qin Feng. Wuyi: "Master Wang Yuxing, repair my spear." "Mencius. "Liang Hui Wang": "Suppress Wang Xing Jiabing, Wei Shichen, build grievances with the princes, and then happily with the heart?"

" Xing " extended to mean prosperity and prosperity. Such as "Zuo Zhuan. "The Thirty-two Years of Zhuanggong": "The country will prosper, the gods will descend, and the virtues will be supervised; when the gods will descend, watch the evils." Three Kingdoms Shu Zhuge Liang (formerly a teacher): Yuan Xiaoren, this pre-Han was prosperous; pro-little people, Yuan Xianchen, after that, the Han was depressed."

" Xing " means interest. Such as "Shi Shuo Xin Yu. "Ren Birth": "I am going to live on the ground, and I will come back when I am exhausted. Why do I see wearing it?" Li Bai of the Tang Dynasty "Lushan Ballad to Lu Shiyu Xu Zhou": "It is a Lushan ballad, and Xing is issued by Lushan."

" Xing " is one of the six meanings of "The Poetry", which means to introduce something else to arouse the chanted word. "Preface to Mao's Poetry": "Therefore, "The Poetry" has six meanings, one is wind, the second is fu, the third is comparison, the fourth is prosperous, the fifth is elegance, and the sixth is ode." "Bixing": "Therefore, those who are compared are attached; those who are prospered are also starting. Those who are attached to reason, cut the category to refer to things; those who are in love, use the slightest proposal."
humanum_short_description_en: Oracle starts from " slip " from " same ", like four hands lifting up a tube or barrel together. Under " Same " or next to "口". The original meaning is to rise up.
humanum_full_description:
甲骨文從「舁」從「同」，象四手共同舉起筒、桶一類的東西。「同」下或加「口」旁。本義是起、起來。《爾雅．釋言》：「興，起也。」《說文》：「興，起也。从舁从同，同力也。」

　　甲骨文用作人名和方國名，如《合集》7076正：「戊午卜，㱿鼎（貞）：弗其及興。」「興」從「同」，甲骨文中可省為「同」，如《合集》：「肩凡（興）㞢（有）疒（疾）。」「同」讀為「興」，表示起，意謂疾病有起色，病情好轉。（蔡哲茂、王子揚）

　　金文用作人名、族氏名，如興鼎：「興乍（作）寶鼎。」表示發動、興兵，如杜虎符：「凡興士被甲，用兵五十人以上，必會君符，乃敢行之。」

　　簡帛文字「興」表示興起，如《郭店簡．唐虞之道》簡8：「六帝興於古，皆𥝩（由）此也。」又表示興兵，如《馬王堆帛書．戰國縱橫家書》264行：「乃䜘（警）四竟（境）之內，興師，言救𩏑（韓）。」又表示徵發，如《睡虎地秦簡．秦律十八種》簡117：「縣葆禁苑、公馬牛苑，興徒以斬（塹）垣離（籬）散及補繕之。」意謂縣應維修禁苑及牧養官有牛馬的苑囿，徵發徒眾為苑囿建造塹壕、墻垣、藩籬并加補修。

　　傳世古書中「興」表示本義的例子如《詩．衛風．氓》：「夙興夜寐，靡有朝矣。」鄭玄箋：早起夜臥。」《論語．衛靈公》：「在陳絕糧，從者病，莫能興。」

　　「興」也表示興起、建立。如《呂氏春秋．大樂》：「四時代興，或暑或寒，或短或長。」《史記．文帝本紀》：「漢興，至孝文四十有餘載，德至盛也。」又表示創立、興辦。如《鹽鐵論．本議》：「邊用度不足，故興鹽、鐵，設酒榷，置均輸，蕃貨長財，以佐助邊費。」

　　「興」表示發動、動員。如《詩．秦風．無衣》：「王于興師，脩我戈矛。」《孟子．梁惠王上》：「抑王興甲兵，危士臣，搆怨於諸侯，然後快於心與？」

　　「興」引申表示昌盛、興旺。如《左傳．莊公三十二年》：「國之將興，明神降之，監其德也；將亡，神又降之，觀其惡也。」三國蜀諸葛亮〈前出師表〉：「親賢臣，遠小人，此先漢所以興隆也；親小人，遠賢臣，此後漢所以傾頹也。」

　　「興」表示興致。如《世說新語．任誕》：「吾吾本乘興而行，興盡而返，何必見戴？」唐代李白〈廬山謠寄盧侍御虛舟〉：「好為廬山謠，興因廬山發。」

　　「興」是《詩》六義之一，意謂先言他物以引起所咏之詞。〈毛詩序〉：「故《詩》有六義焉，一曰風，二曰賦，三曰比，四曰興，五曰雅，六曰頌。」又《文心雕龍．比興》：「故比者，附也；興者，起也。附理者，切類以指事；起情者，依微以擬議。」

Traditional in your browser 繁体字的浏览器显示:興

Traditional in Unicode standard 繁体字的Unicode标准:U+8208

Older traditional characters 旧繁体字/异体字: Not exist

Simplified in your browser 简体字的浏览器显示:兴

Simplified in Unicode standard 简体字的Unicode标准:U+5174

Main pronunciation 主要发音: xìng

Other pronunciations 其它发音: Not exists.

Original meaning 本义: Meaning to work together and thrive.

English senses 英语理解: thrive, prosper, flourish

Usage example 用法举例: 高興 gāo xìng (happy)

Importance by frequency 常用频率: 431

Shuowen 说文解字: 起也從舁從同同力也

Character decomposition 字形分解 :
Compound 興 from four-hands 舁 yú and together 同 tóng A276 兴[興] new-char 兴. (name- four-hands-together (兴)興 xìng)

origin_of_ch_char_book: (同, tong, same) the upper thing means a rammer that is used to harden the ground by ramming, in the middle is the mouth (口, kou, mouth). A ground rammer needs two people to pick up and hit the ground at the same time. When people ramming the ground, they usually shout together. Thus this character is used as ‘same’. This character is also used to express dancing together. (興, 兴, xing=hsing, excitement) has four hands (共, gong, common; altogether) which mean people together. The middle symbolizes ‘ramming the ground together’ (同, tong, same). Therefore, this character implies everyone standing up, hand-in-hand, excitedly dancing and singing together.

①舉辦，發動：興辦。興工。興學。興建。興嘆(發出感嘆聲，如“望洋興興”)。百廢待興。
②起來：夙興夜寐(早起晚睡)。
③旺盛：興盛。興旺。興隆。興衰。復興。興替(興衰)。天下興亡，匹夫有責。
④流行，盛行：時興。新興。
⑤准許：不興胡鬧。
⑥或許：興許。
⑦姓氏。
興奮 [ xīng fèn ]: excited; excitement; (physiology) excitation
①對事物感覺喜愛的情緒：興味。興致。豪興。雅興。敗興。遊興。掃興。即興。助興。興高采烈。

甲骨文從「 舁 」從「 同 」，象四手共同舉起筒、桶一類的東西。「 同 」下或加「 口 」旁。本義是起、起來。《爾雅．釋言》：「興，起也。」《說文》：「興，起也。从舁从同，同力也。」 甲骨文用作人名和方國名，如《合集》7076正：「戊午卜，㱿鼎（貞）：弗其及興。」「 興 」從「 同 」，甲骨文中可省為「 同 」，如《合集》：「肩凡（興）㞢（有）疒（疾）。」「 同 」讀為「 興 」，表示起，意謂疾病有起色，病情好轉。（蔡哲茂、王子揚） 金文用作人名、族氏名，如興鼎：「興乍（作）寶鼎。」表示發動、興兵，如杜虎符：「凡興士被甲，用兵五十人以上，必會君符，乃敢行之。」 簡帛文字「 興 」表示興起，如《郭店簡．唐虞之道》簡8：「六帝興於古，皆𥝩（由）此也。」又表示興兵，如《馬王堆帛書．戰國縱橫家書》264行：「乃䜘（警）四竟（境）之內，興師，言救𩏑（韓）。」又表示徵發，如《睡虎地秦簡．秦律十八種》簡117：「縣葆禁苑、公馬牛苑，興徒以斬（塹）垣離（籬）散及補繕之。」意謂縣應維修禁苑及牧養官有牛馬的苑囿，徵發徒眾為苑囿建造塹壕、墻垣、藩籬并加補修。 傳世古書中「 興 」表示本義的例子如《詩．衛風．氓》：「夙興夜寐，靡有朝矣。」鄭玄箋：早起夜臥。」《論語．衛靈公》：「在陳絕糧，從者病，莫能興。」 「 興 」也表示興起、建立。如《呂氏春秋．大樂》：「四時代興，或暑或寒，或短或長。」《史記．文帝本紀》：「漢興，至孝文四十有餘載，德至盛也。」又表示創立、興辦。如《鹽鐵論．本議》：「邊用度不足，故興鹽、鐵，設酒榷，置均輸，蕃貨長財，以佐助邊費。」 「 興 」表示發動、動員。如《詩．秦風．無衣》：「王于興師，脩我戈矛。」《孟子．梁惠王上》：「抑王興甲兵，危士臣，搆怨於諸侯，然後快於心與？」 「 興 」引申表示昌盛、興旺。如《左傳．莊公三十二年》：「國之將興，明神降之，監其德也；將亡，神又降之，觀其惡也。」三國蜀諸葛亮〈前出師表〉：「親賢臣，遠小人，此先漢所以興隆也；親小人，遠賢臣，此後漢所以傾頹也。」 「 興 」表示興致。如《世說新語．任誕》：「吾吾本乘興而行，興盡而返，何必見戴？」唐代李白〈廬山謠寄盧侍御虛舟〉：「好為廬山謠，興因廬山發。」 「 興 」是《詩》六義之一，意謂先言他物以引起所咏之詞。〈毛詩序〉：「故《詩》有六義焉，一曰風，二曰賦，三曰比，四曰興，五曰雅，六曰頌。」又《文心雕龍．比興》：「故比者，附也；興者，起也。附理者，切類以指事；起情者，依微以擬議。」

Name meaning

xīng, xìng, xìn
вм. 兴
Radicals: 同, 一, ハ  (same, ground, fins, comb)
Meaning Mnemonic
There’s a comb and what looks like the same comb, and you found them on the ground next to some fins you showed interest in. At first, the shiny fins on the ground caught your interest, but once you got closer to the fins you also noticed a pair of combs that are interesting too.
Pick up these fins and the two combs. Feel their weight in each hand as you examine them with interest. Smell the fish smell and feel the teeth on the combs.
Reading Mnemonic
Since the combs interest you more than the fins, you examine the combs more closely. Taking interest in where they were made, you discover they were made in きょうと. Dang, きょうと sure does make some nice combs.
You've always had an interest in きょうと, so it makes sense that you'd be interested in things from きょうと too.
